material.mattext: Your answer to question 1 indicates that if you take a sample of that size, the sample proportion of adults who are pro-choice is:
more than 2.5% away from the proportion who are pro-choice among all US adults.
within 2.5% of the proportion who are pro-choice among all US adults.
exactly equal to the proportion who are pro-choice among all US adults.
Incorrect. The margin of error m means that the sample proportion will be no more than m units away from the known population proportion it estimates.

Good Job. Indeed a sample size of n=1600 guarantees that m=2.5%, which means that the sample proportion that we gets will be no more than 2.5% away from the population proportion it estimates (at the 95% level).

Incorrect. There no sample size large enough that could guarantee some like that! The best we can do is determine a sample size that will guarantee that the sample proportion will be within a certain margin of error of the population proportion it estimates. Review the material on this page again.
